meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel upset or angry.
meanings.sent1: His rude comment trigged her and she stormed out of the room.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise trigged a reaction from the dog, who started barking.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected cancellation of the event trigged a mix of disappointment and frustration.
meanings.sent4: The mention of her ex-boyfriend trigged a flood of painful memories.
meanings.sent5: The unfair treatment trigged a deep sense of injustice in him.

meanings.definition: To set off or activate a mechanism.
meanings.sent1: Pressing the red button trigged the alarm in the building.
meanings.sent2: The motion sensor trigged the lights to turn on automatically.
meanings.sent3: Accidentally stepping on the pressure plate trigged the trap door to open.
meanings.sent4: The key turning in the lock trigged a series of security measures.
meanings.sent5: The timer finally trigged the explosion, causing chaos in the room.

meanings.sent1: The sprinklers trigged as soon as the fire alarm went off.
meanings.sent2: The car alarm trigged when someone tried to break in.
meanings.sent3: The automated message trigged, informing them of the upcoming meeting.
meanings.sent4: The sensor trigged the warning signal, alerting them to the approaching danger.
meanings.sent5: The device automatically trigged the emergency shutdown procedure.
